column4: Hello. Is it possible to remote compute into another Ubuntu box? (not ssh, but something similar to Windows Remote Computing)
Ravel_: any hints for me to google?
easiest way is system > prefs > remote desktop, and enable sharing on the target machine, then use Remote Desktop Viewer
i'm using xubuntu, so i don't have system -> prefs -> remote desktop. do you know what package it is?
it's a part of the Gnome desktop
ahh, oi. i'm using xfce. i'll have to find an equivalent
would you recommend remote desktop in practice? or is there really no advantage over ssh?
/ Ravel_: i need to help troubleshoot a friend's ubuntu box remotely. i don't know whether i could simply use ssh and poke around, or whether i need to install some remote desktop software
I use ssh for all my administration
they are running gnome. but i'm running xfce
you can set up the server on their end like I mentioned, then use any vnc client on your end
you can do everything over ssh, one of the great things about ubuntu is that gui tools don't mess up text config files
